text: Cwrt y Gollen ("Hazel Court") is a British Army training base, 2 miles (3 km) south-east of Crickhowell and just north of the A40 road and the River Usk, in southeastern Powys, Wales. ==History== Cwrt y Gollen became the regional centre for infantry training as the Welsh Brigade Depot in 1963. It was announced in 1984 that the depot would close in the interests of economy. ==References== Category:Villages in Powys Category:Barracks in Wales Category:Installations of the British Army
